solution_line_template: On Monday there are {percent_less_monday} * {tuesday_cars} = <<{percent_less_monday}*{tuesday_cars}={monday_less_cars}>>{monday_less_cars} cars passing the street less than on Tuesday.
So on Monday, there are {tuesday_cars} - {monday_less_cars} = <<{tuesday_cars}-{monday_less_cars}={monday_cars}>>{monday_cars} cars on Happy Street.
On Wednesday, there are {monday_cars} + {wednesday_increment} = <<{monday_cars}+{wednesday_increment}={wednesday_cars}>>{wednesday_cars} cars on this street.

On Thursday and Friday, there is a total of {thursday_friday_cars_per_day} * {thursday_friday_days} = <<{thursday_friday_cars_per_day}*{thursday_friday_days}={thursday_friday_total}>>{thursday_friday_total} cars passing.
On the weekend {weekend_cars_per_day} * {weekend_days} = <<{weekend_cars_per_day}*{weekend_days}={weekend_total}>>{weekend_total} cars are passing.

So from Monday through Sunday, there are {monday_cars} + {tuesday_cars} + {wednesday_cars} + {thursday_friday_total} + {weekend_total} = <<{monday_cars}+{tuesday_cars}+{wednesday_cars}+{thursday_friday_total}+{weekend_total}={total_cars}>>{total_cars} cars traveling down the street.
